abstract: Federal Judge Sarah Netburn orders Chinese real estate magnate Ng Lap Seng held without bond for misleading United States authorities about why he more than $4.5 million in cash to the US during 11 trips since 2013; orders Ng's assistant Jeff C Yin detained on same charge; it is unclear what NG did with cash, although he is best known for connection to 1990s Democratic campaign finance scandal.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors say that Ng Lap Seng, a Chinese real estate magnate, lied to the authorities about how he used more than $4.5 million in cash that he brought into the United States.

headline.main: Chinese Magnate Is Accused of Lying About Millions in Cash He Brought to U.S.
headline.print_headline: Chinese Magnate Is Accused of Lying About Millions in Cash He Brought to U.S.

snippet: Prosecutors say that Ng Lap Seng, a Chinese real estate magnate, lied to the authorities about how he used more than $4.5 million in cash that he brought into the United States.
